<h2>Interpolate Community Data</h2>

<h3>Description</h3>

<p>Transforms community data to proportions, interpolates it, and returns it.
</p>


<h3>Usage</h3>

<pre><code class='language-R'>interpolate_community_data(data, ...)
</code></pre>


<h3>Arguments</h3>

<table>
<tr><td><code id="data">data</code></td>
<td>
<p>A data frame containing community data to be transformed and interpolated.</p>
</td></tr>
<tr><td><code id="...">...</code></td>
<td>
<p>Additional arguments passed to the 'interpolate_data' function.</p>
</td></tr>
</table>


<h3>Details</h3>

<p>Transforms data to proportions using 'transform_to_proportions' and total
pollen count from 'get_pollen_sum'. Then interpolates using 'interpolate_data'.
</p>


<h3>Value</h3>

<p>A data frame with interpolated community data.
</p>

</main>
